boardgame.name: Krimi Total Fall 1: Der Duft des Mordes
boardgame.description:
Translation - "The smell of murder"

This Essen 2005 release could be a fresh start for the "murder/mystery games", that were quiet popular in the eighties in germany.

All players (4 male, 4 female + 1 m/f) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer (wich is the only person, who´s allowed to lie).

boardgame.name: Motor Racing
Pit Stop
boardgame.description: Pit Stop is a Formula One themed racing game where players roll the dice and move along the race track to be the first across the finish line. Various "Chance Spaces" add some variety by forcing players to re-roll the dice and refer to a "Chance Table" which has a variety of moves that can affect any of the players in the game. Players may also vary the progress of the game by changing lanes to try and block another player or by moving to an inside lane to decrease the total number of spaces until the finish.

boardgame.name: China: Erweiterung
boardgame.description:
This small expansion for China was available for free at the ABACUSSPIELE booth during Essen 2005. It is now freely available for download from Michael Schacht's website (see the Links section below).

With this expansion, bonus chips (in three colors) are randomly placed on house spaces at non-intersection points -- two per region. Players placing houses at these spots take the bonus chips. At the end of the game, points are awarded to whoever holds a majority of each color chip.

Expands:

China

boardgame.name: Sushi Express
boardgame.description: The players pilot their maneuverable, little delivery cars around the city in order to serve as many customers as possible. When you pass by in your Sushi Express, you may choose a customer card. When doing so, you’d like to get as many different types of cards as possible, as that’s how you get the most victory points. But don’t ignore the tips - whoever has the least at the end of the game gets minus points.

boardgame.name: Strat-Ops
boardgame.description:
Spirit Racing and Entertainments were a small UK publisher in the seventies and early eighties based in Croydon, Surrey which transformed into the Spirit Games shops in Burton-on-Trent (they have three shops on one street!).

Strat-Ops is a combination of a roll-and-move monopoly-like outer track where types of actions are determined, and an abstract wargame between two sets of opposing allies played in the centre of the board where the actions are applied.

Players have factories to produce Heavy Bombers, Medium Bombers, Day Fighters, Fuel and Munitions, Tanks and Air Defence - and these are used to attack the enemy's armies, factories and convoys.

You win the game by having all your enemy players in one of the following states:
(a) Capital city is captured
(b) All factories are destroyed
(c) All Fuel and Munitions factories are destroyed and no reserves are left

From the 24-page rulebook:
Strat-ops is an ingenious and exciting game originally devised by a British airman during the Second World War. It is played with 2, 4, or 6 players and is suitable for anyone aged ten upwards. players need luck as well as skill, so the game can be a challenge for the enthusiast or simply an absorbing evening's fun.

boardgame.name: Menschen, Würfel, Temperamente
boardgame.description: Menschen, Würfel, Temperamente is a german game, inspired by Pachisi. Each pawn has a different temperament. The sanguine type is allowed to jump over other pawns. The apathetic pawn can move backwords. The choleric beats every pawn in every field he passes by. The melancholic just behaves like a standard Pachisi-pawn. Although it's primarily a dice rolling game, the different types of pawns/temperaments add some tactical elements to it.

boardgame.name: Star Fleet Battles: Module G1 – Master Annex File
boardgame.description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

Star Fleet Battles Master Annex File: All of the juicy details of every ship and fighter. Completely updated. Many sections have been reorganized for easier player access.

Master Ship Chart: Over a thousand ships, listed by crew, marines, BPV, spare shuttles, rules references, year in service, turn mode, explosion strength, command rating, and more. Integrates all products to date (except X-Ships and Simulator Ships) completely updated.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

boardgame.name: Oh Scrap!
boardgame.description:
This game offers players a chance to show off their scrapbooking prowess in a fast paced card game that takes about 30 minutes to play. Players attempt to build a perfect scrapbook layout by mixing Title, Photos, Embellishments and other elements. But beware! The other players are working hard on their own designs and everyone is limited to the same box of supplies. As you try to gather the needed supplies for your masterpiece your "helpful" friends will be providing you with their cast-offs and useless items.

In the end you will each have a complete scrapbook design. Will yours inspire envy or pity?

boardgame.name: This Game Sucks
boardgame.description:
Prepare to do battle with the greatest foe you have ever faced. It's more insidious than a secret agent, more cunning than a cyber-ninja and more devastating than than a three headed dragon with a hangover.

This Game Sucks places you in the battle of your life as you match wits with a bumbling GameMaster and his poorly planned plot lines. As you struggle to free yourself from the warped, twisted, and totally lame RPG you have landed in you will meet many familiar figures. Thwart the tedious ramblings of the Rules Lawyer. Berate the Closet Gamer as he is forced to make yet another excuse to his girlfriend. And find subtle cruel ways to torment the Gamer's Little Brother as you force the GM to finally give up all hope and quit the game.
